title: How to Make Multicolored Corn‐Shaped Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to the directed heat on your sugar cookie dough recipe.
Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Roll out the cookie dough on a floured surface.
Cut out the sugar cookie dough using a corn-shaped cookie cutter.
Place the cut-out cookies on the baking sheet.
Bake the cookies for about ten minutes, until the edges are slightly brown.
Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool them on a wire rack.
Mix the yellow food coloring into one cup of icing.
steps.description: Stir with a spoon and set aside.

steps.headline: Spread the rest of the plain frosting carefully over each cookie with a butter knife.
steps.description: Smooth the frosting out, creating a smooth layer.

steps.headline: Decorate the "husks".
steps.description: Using the yellow icing, decorate the corn stalks using a frosting pipe. Be creative when frosting the "husks"; try creating curly lines or thin lines to fill in all the cookies.

steps.headline: Place the "kernels".
steps.description: Using the Reese's Pieces, make the corn "kernels" by placing them onto each cookie. You do not have to fill in the entire cookie with the pieces - try leaving a few spaces to have the cookies resemble a more realistic Indian corn.

steps.headline: Allow the icing to harden for about ten minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the cookies on a serving plate. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to the directed heat on your sugar cookie dough recipe.  Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.  Roll out the cookie dough on a floured surface.  Cut out the sugar cookie dough using a corn-shaped cookie cutter.  Place the cut-out cookies on the baking sheet.  Bake the cookies for about ten minutes, until the edges are slightly brown.  Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool them on a wire rack.  Mix the yellow food coloring into one cup of icing. Stir with a spoon and set aside. Spread the rest of the plain frosting carefully over each cookie with a butter knife. Smooth the frosting out, creating a smooth layer. Decorate the "husks". Using the yellow icing, decorate the corn stalks using a frosting pipe. Be creative when frosting the "husks"; try creating curly lines or thin lines to fill in all the cookies. Place the "kernels". Using the Reese's Pieces, make the corn "kernels" by placing them onto each cookie. You do not have to fill in the entire cookie with the pieces - try leaving a few spaces to have the cookies resemble a more realistic Indian corn. Allow the icing to harden for about ten minutes.  Serve. Place the cookies on a serving plate. Enjoy!
